question_1.question: What is the primary function of semantic models in a data warehouse?

options.option_a: To store raw data for future processing
options.option_b: To serve as the extraction layer for data
options.option_c: To represent the culmination of all extraction, transformation, and loading processes

question_1.explanation: Semantic models are the serving layer in a data warehouse, representing the culmination of all the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) that happens prior to the tables being added to the semantic model.

question_2.question: What does Model-Level Security in TimeXtender Semantic Security allow developers to do?

options.option_a: Restrict access to specific rows within a table
options.option_b: Implement role-based access to the semantic model
options.option_c: Encrypt the data at the database level
options.option_d: Automatically back up the semantic model

question_2.explanation: TimeXtender Semantic Security allows developers to implement role-based access to the semantic model, which can provide access to either the entire model or a subset of the model data.

question_3.question: How is Row-Level Security configured in TimeXtender?

options.option_a: By creating a role that is associated with an endpoint
options.option_b: By creating a Row-Level Security Setup under a specific field
options.option_c: By encrypting specific fields within the database
options.option_d: By manually entering user permissions for each row

question_3.explanation: Row-Level Security is configured by creating a Row-Level Security Setup under a specific field, which specifies which field values the role will have access to.

question_4.question: What is the result of associating a role with a Row-Level Security Setup that grants access to West Territory field values?

options.option_a: The role will have access to data in all territories
options.option_b: The role will have access to data only in the East territory
options.option_c: The role will not have access to data outside of the West territory
options.option_d: The role will have access to data without any territorial restrictions

question_4.explanation: Associating a role with a Row-Level Security Setup that grants access to West Territory field values means that any role associated with this security setup will not have access to data that is outside of the West territory.
